author: Special Correspondent
text:
A large number of farmers participated in a training programme on crop residue management held in Vettukattu village at Kadayampatti block recently.

The programme was organised by Agricultural Technology Management Agency (ATMA).

A. Nazar, Assistant Director of Agriculture, presided over the training and elaborated on technology involved in preparation of sugarcane trash mulching.

M. Sampathkumar, Agricultural officer, explained preparation of vermi composting to ensure additional income in farm activities.

K. Rajendran, Block Technology Manager, said that technology involved in preparation enriched farmyard manure. S. Ganajothimurugan , Assistant Agricultural Officer, spoke on subsidy schemes involved in crop residue management.

G. Rathinasamy, progressive farmer, imparted technical training to the farmers. A demonstration was done with preparation of enriched farmyard manure.
title: Training for farmers
